brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to establish, through ultrasound, measurements of the   thigh
      muscles (Biceps Femoris and Vastus Lateralis)and the chronic effects of a static stretching
      program on the muscle-tendon unit these muscles.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Thigh Muscle After a Stretching Program
clinical_study.condition: Assessment of Muscle Architecture and Tendon After Chronic Stretching Program

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  physically active male volunteers

          -  soldiers of the Army School of Physical Education of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

          -  young men

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  any musculoskeletal disorder in the lower limbs

          -  neurological or cardiovascular disease experienced previous to or reported during the
             study.

intervention.intervention_name: static stretching exercise on 3 times a week during 8 weeks. Sets number: three of 30 seconds with intervals of equal duration

facility.name: School of Physical Education of Rio de Janeiro

clinical_study.official_title: BICEPS FEMORIS AND VASTUS LATERALIS MUSCLE ARCHITECTURE AFTER A CHRONIC STRETCHING PROGRAM

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Thigh Muscle After a Stretching Program
primary_outcome.time_frame: after 8 weeks that static stretching protocol was applied

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Federal University of Rio de Janeiro
responsible_party.investigator_title: Kelly Lima of Federal University of Rio de Janeiro

clinical_study.source: Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro

lead_sponsor.agency: Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro
